titleInfo.title: Two treatises on the sizes and distances of the celestial bodies

physicalDescription.extent: Physical characteristics:Material: Eastern laid paperDimensions: 175 x 120 mm leaf [130 x 80 mm written]Foliation: India Office Library foliation stamped in black inkRuling: None visible; 20 (ff. 1v-14r)/14 (ff. 15v-25v) lines per page; vertical spacing 15 (ff. 1v-14r)/11 (ff. 15v-25v) lines per 10 cmScript: Nasta‘līqInk: Black ink, with rubricated headings and overlinings, tables and diagrams in redDecoration: Text frames in red ink on ff. 15v-16rBinding: Undecorated case binding in brown leatherCondition: Minor insect damage (some repaired), minor water damage towards lower edge cornerMarginalia: Some, by more than one handSeals: ff. 1r, 14v, 15r and 25v

mods.abstract: Composite manuscript; folios 1-14 and 15-25 were originally two separate manuscripts, and were written on different papers by different copyists.Front flyleaf i was a pastedown, and was detached from the inside right board (front-i) during conservation work to reveal the inscriptions of H. Waterman and Sergeant Hutchins of the 13th Light Company as well as a rebus written vertically along the edge of the board that reads 'I see you, but you cannot see me'.Contents:(1) al-Kāshī (الكاشي), Sullam al-samāʾ(سلم السماء; ff. 1r-14r);(2) al-Dashtakī (الدشتكي), Safīr al-ghabrāʾ wa-al-khaḍrāʾ(سفير الغبراء والخضراء; ff. 15r-25v).
